headline: Apple races past $4 trillion market value as latest models revitalize iPhone sales
summary: Apple's shares have gained about 13% since the new launches on September 9, in a remarkable turnaround that pushed the stock into positive territory for the first time this year.  "The iPhone accounts for over half of Apple's profit and revenue and the more phones they can get into the hands of people, the more they can drive people into their ecosystem," said Chris Zaccarelli, chief investment officer for Northlight Asset Management, ahead of the milestone.  Apple shares had struggled earlier this year on concerns over tough competition in China and uncertainties around how the company would navigate high U.S. tariffs on Asian economies such as China and India, its major manufacturing hubs.

Apple shares had struggled earlier this year on concerns over tough competition in China and uncertainties around how the company would navigate high U.S. tariffs on Asian economies such as China and India, its major manufacturing hubs.

headline: Fed lookahead, Amazon layoffs, earnings latest: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are moving in positive territory on Tuesday morning as Wall Street looks ahead to the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision and the first round of Big Tech earnings results tomorrow. Magnificent Seven companies Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), and Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG) will be reporting quarterly results on Wednesday, and Amazon (AMZN) and Apple (AAPL) will publish their releases on Thursday. Amazon laid off 14,000 corporate workers on Tuesday after Reuters originally reported on Monday that firings could reach up to 30,000 roles. UnitedHealth Group (UNH), United Parcel Service (UPS), and PayPal (PYPL) all reported third quarter earnings results and their shares are all seeing a boost in pre-market trading. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Corning results hit by weakness in optical fiber unit, shares fall
summary: Shares of the Apple supplier fell more than 7% in premarket trading after the results, though the stock is still up about 88% so far this year.  The company's optical communications division, which accounts for nearly 40% of total revenue, recorded net sales of $1.65 billion for the third quarter, below analysts' average estimate of $1.73 billion, according to LSEG data.  U.S. optical fiber companies Corning, OFS-Felite and Drake Communications have been pressured by slower network investment in China, where authorities in September imposed a 37.9% anti-dumping tariff on imports of Corning's optical fiber products and other cable providers.

raw.headline: Corning results hit by weakness in optical fiber unit, shares fall

U.S. optical fiber companies Corning, OFS-Felite and Drake Communications have been pressured by slower network investment in China, where authorities in September imposed a 37.9% anti-dumping tariff on imports of Corning's optical fiber products and other cable providers.

headline: Apple, Qorvo, Celestica: Trending Stocks
summary: As Apple (AAPL) closes in on a $4 trillion valuation, stocks of suppliers see big moves, with Skyworks (SWKS) and Qorvo (QRVO) joining forces, and Foxconn (2354.TW, 0FJ.F, 0FJ.SG, 0FJ.DU, FXCOF) investing in AI. Talk of a merger between Paramount Skydance (PSKY) and Warner Bros Discovery (WBD) continues. Investors looking for new AI plays increasingly turn to Celestica (CLS, CLS.TO, CTW0.F, CLS.NE, CTW0.MU), following strong Q3 earnings. And the chair of Tesla (TSLA) warns shareholders that Elon Musk may leave if they don't approve his $1 trillion package. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: Skyworks and Qorvo Stocks Soar as the Apple Suppliers Create $22 Billion Chip Business
summary: Skyworks Solutions  and  Qorvo  agreed to merge in a cash-and-stock deal that values the combined radio frequency, analog, and mixed-signal semiconductor maker at around $22 billion.  Qorvo  shareholders will receive $32.50 in cash and 0.96  Skyworks  common shares for each Qorvo share.  When the deal closes, Skyworks stockholders will own 63% of the business and Qorvo shareholders will own the remaining 37%.

raw.headline: Skyworks and Qorvo Stocks Soar as the Apple Suppliers Create $22 Billion Chip Business

Qorvo  shareholders will receive $32.50 in cash and 0.96  Skyworks  common shares for each Qorvo share.  When the deal closes, Skyworks stockholders will own 63% of the business and Qorvo shareholders will own the remaining 37%.

headline: Apple supplier Skyworks held talks to buy rival Qorvo, The Information reports
summary: Qorvo's shares, which have gained about 32% this year, surged more than 10% in trading before the bell, while Skyworks' stock was down about 2%.  As of Monday's close, Qorvo had a market value of $8.54 billion, compared with $11.26 billion for Skyworks, according to LSEG data.  Skyworks Solutions and Qorvo did not immediately respond to requests for comment.

headline: KEYNOTE MAESTRO FREDDIE RAVEL TO AWE AUDIENCE WITH LIFE IN TUNE® EXPERIENCE IN VENTURA COUNTY
summary: Marketing Maven's new client, GRAMMY honored pianist, #1 recording artist, and thought leader Freddie Ravel, is pulling back the curtain on the transformative power of music. Having performed with legends like Earth, Wind & Fire, Madonna, Santana, and Prince, Ravel works with organizations like Google, Apple, Blue Cross, and NASA to bring teams "back in tune," sparking unity, collaboration, and individual performance.
